parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.
Not measurable, immeasurable, to a limitless degree. Immoderate.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An apparently primary word; a measure, literally or figuratively; by implication, a limited portion.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular

str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From meros; to part, i.e. to apportion, bestow, share, or to disunite, differ.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
An apparently primary word; a measure, literally or figuratively; by implication, a limited portion.
To come to, reach as far as. From epi and a cognate of heko; to arrive upon, i.e. Extend to.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
